title: What time is Strictly on tonight and what will the couples be performing to?
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

It's that time again - Strictly Come Dancing returns to our screens for another action-packed weekend of dancing and drama.

The thirteen remaining couples have a lot to live up to following their performances for last week's movie night theme.

And judging by the songs and dances set by show producers, week four could be one of the toughest yet for the remaining hopefuls who will battle it out to lift the Glitterball trophy.

BBC has released all of the routines to be performed in the coming show, and here's where you can find the full list.

What time is Strictly on tonight?

Strictly Come Dancing will air at 6:40pm.

The show is 1 hour and 56 minutes long, so will be on until 8:36pm.

The 17th series of the show airs on BBC One.

What will couples perform to tonight?

Football pundit Alex Scott and professional dancer Neil Jones will Tango to Go Your Own Way by Fleetwood Mac.

Corrie star Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe will Charleston to Single Ladies by Beyonce .

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

EastEnders' Emma Barton and Anton du Beke are set to Vienesse Waltz to Send in the Clowns by Barbara Streisand.

Viscountess Emma Weymouth and partner Aljaz Skorjanec will Jive to Kids in America by Kim Wilde.

TV personality Michelle Visage will Salsa to Quimbara by Johnny Pacheco and Celia Cruz with her dance partner Giovanni Pernice Salsa.

(Image: PA)

And lastly, YouTube star Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard will perform Contemporary to Because You Loved Me by Celine Dion.

Who scored the top score last week?

The top scorers of last week were Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse.

The couple scored the first 10s of the series which put them in first place.

They have impressed judges every week so far - but can they manage to do the same again tonight?

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Who came out bottom last week?

Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton received the lowest score last week.

They were awarded a total of 11 points for their Charleston to Woo Hoo from Kill Bill.

Who was kicked off last week's show?

It's no surprise that Anneka and Kevin waved goodbye to the other couples last week with their low score as they were booted off the show.

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

The pair performed in the dance-off and battled for their place to stay, but unfortunately lost it.

*Strictly airs tonight at 6.40pm on BBC One
description: The fourth week of Strictly Come Dancing airs tonight and it could be the hardest yet - here's why
